intro: Gymnolomia divergens, commonly known as the divergent gymnolomia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Gymnolomia divergens typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
